alert.note: Alert for Rockingham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 27 at 11:22PM EST until January 28 at 3:45AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina, including the following counties, Rockingham and Stokes and south central Virginia, including the following county and independent city, City of Martinsville and Henry. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1120 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is expected in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eden... Reidsville... Martinsville... Wentworth... Mayodan... Madison... Walnut Cove... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
